meanings.definition: To reply or answer in words or writing.
meanings.sent1: I will respond to your email as soon as possible.
meanings.sent2: She always responds to my questions with detailed explanations.
meanings.sent3: The computer tried to respond to my commands but got confused.
meanings.sent4: Her smile responded to his kind gesture.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden seem to respond to the sunlight by blooming beautifully.

meanings.definition: To react to something in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: He tends to respond to criticism by becoming defensive.
meanings.sent2: The baby responded to the music by clapping his hands.
meanings.sent3: The cat responded to the new toy with curiosity and excitement.
meanings.sent4: The team responded to the coach's pep talk with renewed energy.
meanings.sent5: The plants in the garden respond to the rain by growing taller and greener.

meanings.definition: To act in return to an action or stimulus.
meanings.sent1: The police officer had to respond quickly to the emergency call.
meanings.sent2: The company will respond to the competitor's price drop with a special promotion.
meanings.sent3: The dog responded to the treat by wagging its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: The students responded to the teacher's challenge by working harder.
meanings.sent5: The superhero always responds to danger with bravery and determination.
